issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A new unit, integration or system test.
issuetype.name: Test

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A task that needs to be done.
issuetype.name: Task

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: HCatalog
components.description: Tracks issues related to the HCatalog

fields.summary: Wrong check of version format in TestWebHCatE2e.getHiveVersion()

ATTACHMENT ID: 12695846 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build

Patch committed to trunk.
Thanks again [~damien.carol] and [~apivovarov]!

[~thejas] this bug affect also branch-1.0 and branch-1.1 as reported in HIVE-9853.
Could we apply this path to those branches? Should I create two more patchs, one for each branch?

[~damien.carol] Does the patch apply as-is to those branches ? If yes, two new patches aren't needed. We can apply the same one to 1.0 and 1.1 branches. We just need to check with release managers for those releases ([~vikram.dixit] and [~brocknoland] respectively).

[~thejas] yes, I think the patch apply as-is on branch 1.0. It comes from HIVE-9853.
Poke me, if it must be regenerated.
This issue has been fixed and released as part of the 1.2.0 release. If you find an issue which seems to be related to this one, please create a new jira and link this one with new jira.
